required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association of Gut Microbiome With Neonatal Complications and Neurodevelopment in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Association of Gut Microbiome With Neonatal Complications and Neurodevelopment in Preterm Infants

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective cohort study investigating the effect of the formation of gut microbiome on the neonatal disease and the prognosis of neurodevelopment in preterm infants.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate the effect of the formation of gut microbiome on the neonatal disease and the prognosis of neurodevelopment in preterm infants.

primary_outcome.measure: The distribution rate of intestinal microbiome of stool by K-mer based taxonomic assignment
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of gut microbiome with 16s RNA gene specific sequencing in stool, breast milk, gastric juice

primary_outcome.measure: The distribution rate of intestinal microbiome of stool by K-mer based taxonomic assignment
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of gut microbiome with 16s RNA gene specific sequencing in stool, breast milk, gastric juice

primary_outcome.measure: The distribution rate of intestinal microbiome of stool by K-mer based taxonomic assignment
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of gut microbiome with 16s RNA gene specific sequencing in stool, breast milk, gastric juice

primary_outcome.measure: The distribution rate of intestinal microbiome of stool by K-mer based taxonomic assignment
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of gut microbiome with 16s RNA gene specific sequencing in stool, breast milk, gastric juice

secondary_outcome.measure: Bayley scales of infant and toddler development, third edition
secondary_outcome.description: For neurodevelopmental screening, Bayley scales of infant and toddler development, third edition yields composite scores for each cognitive, language, motor. It is considered normal when >85. Developmental delay is diagnosed when the mean result is below 85. Neurodevelopmental screening is considered normal when a child achieves these all.
Major morbidity such as bronchopulmonary dysplasia, periventricular leukomalacia, retinopathy of prematurity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: with in 24 hours after birth, in 2 weeks, in 3~5 weeks, at 37~40 weeks of postmenstrual age
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of inflammation markers such as Interleukin(IL)-1 beta/IL-1F2, IL-6, IL-8/CXCL8, Tumor necrosis factor(TNF)-alpha, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of short chain fatty acid at 4 period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: with in 24 hours after birth, in 2 weeks, in 3~5 weeks, at 37~40 weeks of postmenstrual age
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of short chain fatty acid in stool and blood at 4 period

biospec_descr.textblock: gastric juice, blood, stool, breast milk, transtracheal aspirates

study_pop.textblock: Preterm infants who are born at < 28 weeks of gestation and admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit at Seoul national university children's hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preterm infants
- born less than 28+0 weeks gestation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major congenital anomalies
